name: Florian Michahelles
content: Florian Michahelles — TU Wien Informatics People Overview Professors Scientific Staff Administrative Staff Student Staff External Lecturers By Responsibilities By Committee By Name Related Guest Professors Honoraries Alumni (LinkedIn) #5qw Florian Michahelles Univ.Prof. Dipl.-Inf. Dr.sc.techn. Research Focus Information Systems Engineering: 20% Visual Computing and Human-Centered Technology: 80% Research Areas Digital Companion, Entrepreneurship, Internet of Things, Human-centered AI, Ubiquous computing, Digitization, Industry 4.0 About My name is Florian Michahelles. I have joined TU Wien as a full professor for ubiquitous computing. I investigate how we can apply technology to support humans in their tasks and activities while keeping the human user in control. How can we wrap computing capabilities into proactive services, how can we leverage AI to free users from routine and mundane tasks, and let them focus on what we humans are best at: creativity, problem solving, critical thinking, and social collaboration. Roles Full Professor Artifact-based Computing and User Research, E193-04 Curriculum Commission for Informatics Principal Member Curriculum Coordinator Bachelor / Specialization / Human-Centered Computing Contact florian.michahelles@tuwien.ac.at +43-1-58801-193416 Favoritenstrasse 11, Room HE0209 vCard from TISS Artefact-based Design and User Research orcid.org/0000-0003-1486-0688 informatics.tuwien.ac.at/people/florian-michahelles tiss.tuwien.ac.at/person/333566 Courses 2025W Artifact-based Design / 193.161 / VU Bachelor Thesis for Informatics and Business Informatics / 187.A99 / PR Design and Fabrication / 193.132 / VU Human-Centered AI / 193.162 / VU Orientation Informatics and Business Informatics / 180.766 / VU Project in Computer Science 1 / 193.117 / PR Project in Computer Science 2 / 193.118 / PR Scientific Research and Writing / 193.052 / SE Seminar for PhD Students / 187.A72 / SE 2026S Seminar for PhD Students / 187.A72 / SE Projects AIM: Multimodal Intent Communication of Autonomous Systems 2025 – 2027 / Austrian Science Fund (FWF) STARTS 2025 – 2026 / EU-Kommission DG-XII ERIKA - Die digitale Begleiterin für klimabewusstes Handeln im Alltag 2024 – 2026 / Arbeiterkammer Niederösterreich Eternity Bike -Evaluierung des Nutzerpotentials eines teilautomatisierten Fahrrades 2022 – 2023 / Austrian Research Promotion Agency (FFG) AI Facility Manager 2021 / Siemens AG Österreich Publications 2025 Impact of Time Discrepancies on Machine Learning Performance for Multi-Wearable Human Activity Recognition / Wolling, F., Kostolani, D., Trollmann, P., & Michahelles, F.
